item.title: Report E-2025040380
item.description:
Report E-2025040380

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: BALDWINSVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift loader was attempting to fit one last pallet on the rear of a trailer. The pallet being loaded was shorter than the fork blades which were sticking out slightly from the back side. One of the blades punctured the drum. Action was taken immediately to mitigate the spill. The drum placed into an overpack to minimize the spill. All spill clean up materials were also placed in a separate overpack in preparation for disposition. The affected area was neutralized with spill x powder and properly cleaned.

item.title: Report E-2025040037
item.description:
Report E-2025040037

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-01
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 55-gallon metal drum containing hazardous product, Leaded Race Fuel. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 55-gallons released onto the entire wooden trailer floor, the asphalt beneath the trailer in a 60’x10’ area, and a drain (catch basin) as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor cleaned up the release using a vac truck and oil dry. One 85-gallon DF containing the empty damaged drum was generated for waste disposal along with three 55-gallon DM’s containing impacted absorbents, and 2,800-gallons of impacted water inside of the vac truck. XPO will manage the waste drums created from the response and ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac truck liquids at a local third-party disposal site. No waterways or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025040286
item.description:
Report X-2025040286

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS AVIATION SERVICES, INCORPORATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 19th a drum was discovered in the DG hold area that was leaking. The drum was in the hold area for an extended period of time due to customs clearance issues and was awaiting disposition form the customer. It was not leaking when originally put in the hold area. It has been contained into a steel salvage drum and has been sent for disposal.
